alert.note: Alert for Greenlee (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 17 at 12:35PM MST until January 17 at 2:45PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by a prolonged period of rainfall will continue. * WHERE...A portion of Southeast Arizona, including the following county, Greenlee. * WHEN...Until 1245 PM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. The low water crossing on Lower Eagle Creek Road will be impassible for an extended period. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1230 PM MST, The water level in Eagle Creek will continue to increase into the afternoon with flooding of low water crossings, especially near the town of Morenci. Once the creek level starts to fall it will do so very slowly and remain elevated for several days. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southwestern Greenlee County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
